definition: to storm/to attack directly
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
pound/beat/hull/attack/disturb/stir
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem

sentences.english: From there, the Spain striker curled a shot into the top corner of the net.
sentences.chinese: 就在那里，西班牙前锋的一个弧线球直捣球网的上方。

sentences.english: He directed his troops toward the Nile Delta.
sentences.chinese: 他挥师直捣尼罗河三角洲一带。

sentences.english: Enterprise clarifies, cuts through, and captures, the essence of the evolutionary spirit.
sentences.chinese: 进取心可以厘清一切，披荆斩棘直捣演化的精髓。

sentences.english: The news was that the mob had broken down the barricades and were even then preparing to storm the palace.
sentences.chinese: 传来的消息说暴民已经冲破了路障，正准备直捣宫廷。

sentences.english: The public security men drove straight to the bandits' den with the suddenness of thunder bolt.
sentences.chinese: 公安人员以迅雷不及掩耳之势直捣匪巢。

sentences.english: The rebels stormed the gates of the palace.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱者们直捣宫殿大门。

sentences.english: His argument homed in on the fault of the system.
sentences.chinese: 他的论点直捣这套系统的缺失。

definition: in command of the army
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
surprise attack/raid
to attack and seize
to brandish a spear
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to invade
to defeat/to smash/to rout
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
to attack
